results.description:
SPACE IS LIMITED - PLS REGISTER TO BE ABLE TO ATTEND.

Xamarin.com is our main sponsor for NFLXUG

TekSystems is providing delish food from AngiesSubs

presentation starts at 6pm

The 3 Xamarin Nijas: 

Skip Krenek, Brady Merkel and Brian Keller

will give a the scoop on Xamarin Evolve 2014

if we have time left 

Mark J Radacz will be presenting Xamarin.Forms

using Xamarin 3 for Visual Studio

This is an introduction to the Xamarin.Forms cross-platform UI framework. 


In this session you will learn how to create applications for iOS, Android and Windows Phone 8 and share the code for both the UI and the logic that drives it. We will cover the project structure, layout system, basic controls and navigation support.

Feel free to bring your laptop with the latest copy of Xamarin 

Download free trial at 

http://xamarin.com/platform
results.name: Evolve 2014 update + Xamarin Forms hands on lab..

results.description:
Whether you have a brick & mortar or your business exists primarily online, there are a lot of opportunities for you to leverage the many facets of local marketing, advertising, and networking. 

Join us in October to hear Catherine Byerly of the Jacksonville Business Journal and Jen DeVore Richter of Rock My Image discuss the latest trends in local!

Points to be covered:

• Local publications

• Local directories

• Google My Business

• Local advertising 

• Local apps

Catherine Byerly Digital Producer at the Jacksonville Business Journal. If business news in Jacksonville is happening, she is helping to get it online at the Jacksonville Business Journal. Sometimes that's helping with production, sometimes that means going out into the field and getting the story. She also produces long form pieces for the weekly print edition from time to time and contributes to Jacksonville Business Journal's social media presence.

Jen DeVore Richter is Co-Founder of Rock My Image. As the Accounts Director, she manages client strategic marketing plans, generates ideas and crafts messaging. One of her goals is to ensure that the internet marketing efforts are integrated with client's offline marketing efforts and contribute to set goals. At Rock My Image, they like to say that Jen is the "tour manager" booking gigs, ensuring projects are kept on track, and taking care of their superstar clients. Connect with her on Twitter @JenRDeVore.

RSVP Today! 

*$10 Ticket Fee goes towards event space, light refreshments and event costs.
results.name: How to Integrate Local Marketing, Advertising & Networking

group.name: Jacksonville Online Marketing for Businesses & Entrepreneurs

results.description: A brief review of techniques, tips and tricks to nimbly navigate your Database as understood through a information gathering and custom list perspective.    By assimilating proven techniques of mentors, this lesson offers a myriad of refined concepts, structures and habits to go beyond the syntax of queries into the efficiency and effectiveness relative to your individual use.   By investigating the essence of real world masters successes and providing a digestible summary of the essential techniques this lesson hopes to expand your paradigms of what, how and why you do what you do when organizing your code.

results.description: The Jacksonville Linux Users' Group (JaxLUG) is a monthly meeting dedicated to providing free (as in speech) information to anyone interested in participating. Our presentations vary widely, including beginners Linux installation and usage, network configuration, software installation and configuration, information security, advanced scripting, and much more. Our presentations are by members of the community, and suggestions are always welcome if there's a subject you'd like to know more about!
results.name: JaxLUG- Jacksonville Linux User Group

results.description:
Sails is the most popular MVC framework for Node.js. It is designed for building practical, production-ready Node.js apps in a matter of weeks - not months.
Sails makes it easy to build custom, enterprise-grade Node.js apps. It is designed to emulate the familiar MVC pattern of frameworks like Ruby on Rails, but with support for the requirements of modern apps: data-driven APIs with a scalable, service-oriented architecture. It's especially good for building chat, realtime dashboards, or multiplayer games; but you can use it for any web application project - top to bottom.
results.name: Sails MVC Node.js Framework

results.description:
Ethical Hacking is a crucial skill to have in your toolset regardless of what path you decide to take in IT and as technology is becoming more and more involved in our lives, it's now more important than ever for information security to be taken more seriously by all sides of the house. As with most offensive/defensive strategies in life, how do you know they work if your not testing them?

This FREE & OPEN TO THE PUBLIC class is hosted by JaxHax Ethical Hacker Travis Phillips and will provide tips and tricks to building your own hacking lab at home so you can hone your skills in a safe, controlled, and most importantly; legal environment! This class is the second part of the Ethical Hacking Series and will lay the ground work to building a lab you can use to practice what you learn in the future classes of the series.

Previous presentations from this series can be found at: http://wiki.jaxhax.org/index.php/Ethical_Hacking_Series
results.name: Ethical Hacking Series: 0x02 - Building Your Own DIY Hacking Lab

results.description:
JaxHax LAN Party!

What is a LAN party?
A LAN party is where people get together to play computer games together on a Local Area Network (LAN).  JaxHax has a huge facility and very fast LAN and we will be having quite a lot of fun down at the space.  Sign up, come on down and have a great time!


Entry Cost: $20 for members, $30 for non-members, pay at the door

Schedule:
Friday:
Armagetron: 22:00
Saturday:
Starcraft 1: 01:00
Counter-Strike Source: 03:00
Saltybet: 05:00
JaxHax buy-in Lunch: 12:00
League of Legends Tournament: 14:00
Soldat Tournament FFA: 17:00
JaxHax buy-in Dinner: 19:00
Counter-Strike Global Operatives: 22:00
Sunday:
Unreal Tournament 2k4: 01:00
Warcraft 3: 03:00
SaltyBet: 05:00
JaxHax buy-in Lunch: 12:00
StarCraft 2: 13:00
Dota2: 17:00
JaxHax buy-in Dinner: 19:00
Supreme Commander: 20:00
SaltyBet: 23:00

What do to before you get to the party:
* Download all the games you want to play at the party
* Make sure all your games are up to date (this is very important): Steam games, Starcraft 2, LoL, ect need to be updated before you get there!
* Update your operating system patches, and your antivirus software. Scan your computer, if you have viruses and you cannot get rid of them, ask an admin to assist you before you jack in.

What to bring to the party:
* 6plug or hotfoot
* Ethernet Cable
* Computer
* Mouse + Keyboard
* Headphones (please avoid using speakers)
* Monitor (preferably lcd)
* optional: chair

Where is the party:
700 E Union St, Jacksonville, FL 32206, Unit 2A
Fenced side of the building
If at all possible, please carpool.
www.jaxhax.org

What to do when you get there:
* Park in the loading area, bring your stuff up
* Sign in, pay, get tokens, get parking area notice
* Find a place to set up, put your stuff there
* Move your car to the specified parking area
* Set up your machine, start gaming!

Rules:
* Those who violate these rules will be punished up to removal and banning from the facility.
* Registered users only, people without machines (guests) MUST also check in with the staff
* Non-members are not to explore the space without supervision, with the exception of the bathroom
* No Horseplay
* No excessive internet downloading, please update your steam library before you come
* No hacking/cheating
* BYOB we will not be providing any, do not give alcohol to minors
* No drunken misconduct / general dangerous behaviour
* Be nice to your neighbor, yelling and good ol lan party catcalling/ribbing is expected but do not let it get out of hand.
results.name: JaxHax LAN Party

results.name: UNF User Group Expo

results.description:
Xenia Mountrouidou is currently an assistant professor at Jacksonville University, Department of Computing Science. She was a post-doc researcher at the College of William and Mary working on analytical modeling for power savings, reliability and performance on disk drives. Previously she held a position as a Software Performance Engineer for the WebSphere Application Server Performance team at IBM, Research Triangle Park. She received her Ph.D. from North Carolina State University. She has authored scholarly papers in the areas of performance modeling, computer networks, and embedded computer architectures. Her research interests include computing for sustainability, computer networks, performance modeling, and cyber security. She will be presenting her work on an interdisciplinary project with biologist Dr. Mike Stine on data processing for better understanding of the Florida aquifer. For the past ten years the North Florida Springs Alliance has been performing fauna counts in the underwater caves of Northeast Florida. We have performed exploratory analysis, clustering, and data visualization to find how the populations are affected by the river stage, time, and location in a cave. Our results show temporal, spatial correlations of fauna counts as well as how the river stage affects the population. As always, it'll be a laid back atmosphere with pizza, beer, and soft drinks. Schedule:
5:30-6:15 Pizza, Beer, and Socializing
6:15-6:30 Book Giveaways, Introductions
6:30-7:30 Data Analysis of Fauna Populations of the Florida Aquifer with Xenia Mountrouidou
7:30-8:00 Questions and Closing Remarks Please call Katie at [masked] if you have any trouble finding the location or have any questions.
results.name: Data Analysis of Fauna Populations of the Florida Aquifer

results.description:
All,

So you use Apache log4j, right? The industry's most widely used logging framework. Since its inception, thousands of industry tools also use log4J. You might be familiar with the the tens of log 4J appenders available with it too. But in a transactional online application, where thousands of concurrent users are logging in, how do you filter each user activity ? After certain months, you are ought to say that your log files are overwritten and you can't find the information you are looking for.

Why don't we combine the ability of log4j with the salient features of big data? In this presentation, filled with Java stuff, let me show you an industry first (hopefully the best) approach to logging, eliminating your frustrations( if any) with log4J.


We will implement and and you will learn a new architecture paradigm which you can extend to any levels in your enterprise.


See you, and don't miss. Not only this is the first of its kind in the big data world, but an innovation in industry too. So learn this before anyone else...aboslutely free to my meetup friends


Best, Hadoopean.
results.how_to_find_us: From the entrance, turn to your right, we will be at Room B
results.name: Centralized Logging - Industry First Approach to HBase Fans

results.description:
Location: 


FSCJ Downtown Campus
Advanced Technology Center (ATC)

(Room T-112) 
101 W. State Street, Jacksonville, FL 32202

TekSystems is providing
breakfast: Panera
lunch: Angie's Subs 

Nokia US and DVLUP providing free swag and giveaways


Guest  speaker(s) TBA


Come learn new tips and tricks for developing award winning Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 apps  

breakfast, lunch and afternoon coffee will be provided  

This will be a hands-on hackathon so be sure to bring your laptop preconfigured with Visual Studio 2013, including the Windows Phone SDK.



------- IMPORTANT DETAILS AND HACKATHON RULES -------

This hackathon is themed around the challenges on DVLUP.com, a free rewards program site run by Nokia for Windows Phone developers. On DVLUP.com you earn experience points (XP) by completing challenges and then can redeem these XP for prizes, everything from Windows Phone swag to Amazon gift cards to Nokia Lumia phones.

At the hackathon, you will be provided with a handful of app challenges to choose from, hand picked by the event organizers because they should be able to be completed or mostly completed in a day. Sample code and other resources will be provided, along with expert help from mentors. These challenges will include but are not limited to apps that use NFC communications, Nokia Maps, and the phone's camera.


So what can you walk away with by participating in this event? 


we will have DVLUP giveaways for registered geeks and special prizes for apps published within 2 weeks



What do I need to bring?


Bring your own Windows 8 laptop if possible. There will be a very limited number of systems available if you do not have this, but not nearly enough for everyone. Please let us know in advance if you need access to a PC.

Most but not all DVLUP challenges require the app be developed for Windows Phone 8. Unfortunately the Windows Phone 8 development tools only run on Windows 8 (64 bit) systems. You will need the Windows Phone 8 SDK installed, and it is highly recommended you do this ahead of time, download here http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35471

If you don't have a Windows 8 machine, all is not lost. If you have Windows 7 or Vista you can develop apps for Windows Phone 7. You will be limited in the challenges you can develop for, but will still qualify for all of the promotions. Please install the Windows Phone 7.1 SDK ahead of time, link: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=27570
results.name: App Camp Day Jax hackathon +UX Designers Welcome

results.description:
Join The JOMM and Tommy Hobin of DiscoverTec.

 


Internet marketing is a broad topic. With strategy comes process, with process comes efficiency - and of course with efficiency comes more strategy. Because there are so many channels online to potentially market your clients, processes are necessary to set expectations, keep up with trends and most importantly bill your clients fairly. Every step of your strategy needs a process. From pitching a prospective client to maintaining your hard-earned #1 position on the Google SERP's, processes run our business. Learn how to understand, build and maintain your process to help your clients and your business.


RSVP Today! Complimentary snacks, beer, and wine included with ticket.

*Ticket fee goes toward event space, refreshments and event costs.
results.name: Defining your Processes

group.name: Jacksonville Online Marketing for Businesses & Entrepreneurs

meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
